method.text: Mix together the ginger, sherry, light soy sauce, wine vinegar and clear honey into a bowl along with the pineapple juice. Stir in the strips of pork. Toss well together. Cover and leave to marinate for 1 - 1 days in the fridge.
Drain the pork, reserving the marinade. Blend a little of the marinade with the cornflour.
Heat the sesame oil in a wok or frying pan. Stir fry the pork and cook for 3-4 min or until just tender.
Add the pineapple chunks, pepper, sweetcorn, mange-tout and cashew nuts. Stir fry for a further 3 min.
Stir the remaining marinade into the cornflour mixture then pour into the wok or frying pan. Season and cook for a further 2-3 min or until the sauce has thickened.

title: Stir-fried pork
